wikipedia_page.main: Andrew Henry VC (1 November 1823 – 14 October 1870) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross.

response: Among the more famous graves is that of the Reverend Robert Stephen Hawker, the author of The Song of the Western Men. As at November 2016 there are 769 war graves from the First World War, over 200 of which are in a dedicated naval plot; and 198 war graves of the Second World War (including an unidentified airman) are scattered throughout the site. A Victoria Cross (VC) recipient of the Crimean War, Captain Andrew Henry, Royal Artillery, is buried here, as is another VC recipient, of the Taiping Rebellion, Quartermaster George Hinckley, Royal Navy. Burial Locations VC Holders, Devonshire.

response: |Andrew Henry || British Army  || 1854 || Crimean War || Inkerman
*Andrew Henry (VC) (1823–1870), English recipient of the Victoria Cross
*Andrew Henry (fur trader) (c. 1775–1832), American fur trader and co-founder of the Rocky Mountain Fur Company
* Sergeant-Major Andrew Henry, Royal Artillery, winning the V.C. at Inkermann, 5 November 1854 (Royal Artillery Institution?)
